repnme.cdata!:
Egypt - Natural Gas Connections Project :
            implementation completion and results report

abstracts.cdata!:
The Natural Gas Connections Project for
            Egypt received a satisfactory outcome rating with moderate
            risk to development outcome. Both the Bank and the Borrower
            received satisfactory performance ratings for their
            respective roles in the project. There were no
            restructurings or significant changes in the design of the
            project, neither on its implementation arrangements or
            funding allocations. In 2013, the closing date of the
            project was extended by one year to provide sufficient time
            to complete the construction of some pressure reduction
            stations (PRS). Three main lessons were learned from this
            project and include the following: (1) implementing a
            project that focuses exclusively in the deployment of
            physical investments has the advantage of being less
            dependent on the political economy of the country compared
            to a project which tackles delicate institutional reforms,
            (2) Making an effective use of the timespan in between the
            approval of a project and its effectiveness can be very
            useful to avoid unnecessary project delays, and (3)
            embedding a Bank financed operation into a key strategy of a
            client government strongly increases the likelihood of a
            smooth implementation and a successful outcome.
